examples: The mailbox is by the bus stop.

definitions.definition: From one side of something to the other, passing close by; past .
examples: The stream runs by our back door.
He ran straight by me.

definitions.definition: Not later than (the given time); not later than the end of (the given time interval).
examples: Be back by ten o'clock!.
We'll find someone by the end of March.
We will send it by the first week of July.

definitions.definition: Indicates the person or thing that does or causes something : Through the action or presence of.

examples: The matter was decided by the chairman.
The boat was swamped by the water.
He was protected by his body armour.

definitions.definition: Indicates the creator of a work : Existing through the authorship etc. of.
examples: There are many well-known plays by William Shakespeare

definitions.definition: Indicates a means of achieving something : Involving/using the means of.
examples: I'd know you anywhere by your gravelly voice.
I avoided the guards by moving only when they weren't looking.
By Pythagoras' theorem, we can calculate the length of the hypotenuse.
We went by bus.
I discovered it by chance.
By 'maybe' she means 'no'.
The electricity was cut off, so we had to read by candlelight.

definitions.definition: Indicates an authority according to which something is done.
examples: By the power vested in me, I now pronounce you man and wife.

subdefinitions.definition: Invokes an authority in an oath .
examples: By Jove! I think she's got it!
By all that is holy, I'll put an end to this.

definitions.definition: Indicates a means of classification or organisation.
examples: I sorted the items by category.
Table 1 shows details of our employees broken down by sex and age.

definitions.definition: Indicates the amount of change, difference or discrepancy
examples: Our stock is up by ten percent.
We won by six goals to three.
His date of birth was wrong by ten years.

definitions.definition: In the formulae X by X and by Xs , indicates a steady progression, one X after another.
examples: We went through the book page by page.
We crawled forward by inches.

definitions.definition: Acted on in units of the specified size or measure. (Sometimes hyperbolically)
examples: While sitting listening to the radio by the hour, she can drink brandy by the bucketful!
He sits listening to the radio by the hour.

definitions.definition: Per ; with or in proportion to each.
examples: His health was deteriorating by the day.
The pickers are paid by the fortnight by the American bushel.

definitions.definition: Indicates a referenced source : According to.
examples: He cheated by his own admission.
By my reckoning, we should be nearly there.

definitions.definition: Used to separate dimensions when describing the size of something.
examples: It is easy to invert a 2- by -2 matrix.
The room was about 4 foot by 6 foot.
The bricks used to build the wall measured 10 by 20 by 30 cm.

definitions.definition: multiplied by or ( chiefly South Asia ) divided by
Designates a horse's male parent ( sire ); cf. out of .
examples: She's a lovely little filly, by Big Lad, out of Damsel in Distress.

definitions.definition: in a windward direction, sailing near to the direction from which the wind is blowing
